creator: leo@florida.sarang.net
text:
In FreeBSD 4.6-STABLE, mod_cgid for worker MPM left zombie processes for each
CGI script. (In my case all CGI scripts are written in Perl.)

I've installed apache 2.0.43 from FreeBSD's www/apache2 ports directory with
following compilation flags.

# make -DWITH_THREADS -DWITH_EXPERIMENTAL WITH_MPM=worker install

When a CGI is called, it becomes a zombie after normal execution.

creator: trawick@apache.org
text:
The worker MPM (and threaded MPMs in general) are not supported on FreeBSD.
In fact, screwy signal behavior has been seen on FreeBSD with a non-threaded 
MPM (prefork) but thread-enabled APR.

When the next generation of threading is available for FreeBSD (5.0?), there
will be a renewed emphasis on testing thread-capable APR and threaded MPMs
on FreeBSD.

This is a frustrating situation.  A number of us have tried and failed to get 
threaded MPMs working reliably on FreeBSD.

OTOH, the prefork MPM and non-thread-capable APR have been extensively tested
on FreeBSD.
